  2213. I very much like the closeness of the shave, long battery life, but the noise.
  2214. As far as effectiveness in my case, it is certainly does the job but runs a close second to the rotery.
  2215. The solution is to simply grip each cutter firmly but gently between the thumb and forefinger while brushing the hair out of it, and then everything's fine.
  2216. I decided to return mine and do a little better job researching before I choose my next one.
  2217. It is also a little expensive compared to the Braun 1775, which used to be another CR best buy.
  2218. I wash with a 2% salicylic acid based cleanser like Clean and Clear to keep down the acne and bumps.
  2219. It's hard to get up close to your sideburns area - with the rotaries I could kind of push the hair I wanted to keep aside with the shaver as I cut the stubble, but since the foil is so tall it starts to trim back the sideburn hair.
  2220. I've had this shaver for 2 years and the cutting power and effectiveness are great.
  2221. The charging-alert light comes on sooner than expected, and it was only after receiving the shaver that I learned its battery is not replaceable, which means that when it dies the shaver is finished.
  2222. In my opinion, this is clearly a design flaw.
  2223. Much of the unit that was solid plastic or metal on my old Remington, has been replaced by cheaper plastic or rubber.
  2224. The cheap drugstore one I bought years ago even does a better job cutting than this one

All Reviews

  1. Like the dual power mode!
  2. Best I have found for my bald head.
  3. I have owned two predecessors to this. At the time of purchase, this seemed to be the most popular and most reviewed of the Remington Microscreens. When new, the battery runs the motor quite well. Speaking for the older Remingtons, As they age, there is less and less power, and a lower battery plateau. Eventually It does not retain a charge long enough or powerful enough to shave. At that point it needs replacing. The Microscreens also break and they are not cheap to replace. The up side is that it can handle a multi-day wiry beard growth. When shaving that, I usually run the trimmer in the up position to get the maximum effect. The trimmer gets the longer beard and then the screen finishes off for a smooth shave. I don't like going back to the razor and I feel this electric gives a much more consistent shave. I wash with a 2% salicylic acid based cleanser like Clean and Clear to keep down the acne and bumps. (Even older men get acne.)
  4. I must like them because it is my third one I purchased. I wish I could buy replacement batteries unfortunately Remington solders<br />the wires to the battery rather than offer a quick replacement. What a racket!
  5. I think the Remington MS2-390 is great replacement for pricey Braun shaver. While I haven't had the Remington too long (I've had Braun for 20+ years), I'm impressed with the apparent power and close shaves I'm getting with the Remington. Buying it through Amazon also kept me from having to run around trying to find this highly-rated Remington.
  6. I had an older model Remington shaver that did a good job but the trimmer broke after many years. The MS2-390 sounded like a good replacement based on price and reviews. The shaver is smooth and comfortable to use. It give me a quick close shave. Some reviewers mentioned that it was loud but I found it to be quieter than my previous shaver.
  7. TI researched the product at Consumers report and found out that this specific item was rated the highest. Amazon had tyhe best price, the vendor was prompt on delivery and the product was as advertised.
  8. Have used this razor for approximatelly one month. It is faster, quieter, and gives a better shave than my previous electric shaver. A great value.
  9. I purchased this Remington razor because I needed to replace a Braun one (the second one I've owned) and Consumers Report recommended this Remington. This is the first time that I have been dissatisfied with a Consumers Report chose! The new razor does not give me as good a shaves as the old Braun even though it needed a new head and blades. I will go back to Braun!
  10. We ended up sending this back because it did not shave my husband's neck very well. Other than this I think he thought it was ok.
  11. I have owned my MS2-390 for over 4 years. It has been a very good razor. It shaves very close and is comfortable. Following the instructions of allowing the battery to completely discharge every few months, the battery life has been amazing. For the first couple of years I could go nearly 3 weeks between charges. Now I get about a week and a half. I have had only two issues with the product. First, although it shaves very close, it will not get long hairs and allows a few whiskers, especially on the neck, to go untouched. This requires using the edger occasionally to cut these areas. Secondly, the head will become loose easily. I check to make sure the head is firmly in place before each shave. If I don't, I will start the razor and nick the thin foil on the head. I have replaced the head twice since I have owned the razor. I have enjoyed the razor but would like to find one that shaves as close but also gets the longer whiskers.
  12. I bought this shaver to replace a very old Norelco after seeing so many good reviews and a recommendation from [...]. Unfortunately, I just don't like the shave I get from this razor. If you shave every day, it will probably do just fine. If you're like me, however, and shave every 2-3 days it may give you trouble. It seems to just miss a noticeable amount of whiskers (I'd say something like 10%). No amount of going over these hairs will get them and I end up rubbing my face raw. Maybe it's just the way my face is shaped (pretty angular) or the way my hair grows but I can't get it to work for me. I've since switched to a regular razor with much more comfortable shaves in less time and better results. It's too bad I thought I just needed to get used to it for more than the return time or I'd send it back.
  13. I had very high hopes for this razor, which is rated a \\"Best Buy\\" in Consumer Reports. The problem with this type of razor is that is could not shave closely in and out of the contours of my neck, and I would have to repeat the process several times before hair was removed. It was also noisier than my 17-year-old Norelco. In the end, I sent back this razor and bought a cordless Norelco, which is far better at removing facial hair in less time, and it is much quieter as well.
  14. I was looking for a good shaver for my boyfriend. He's an over the road truck driver, so using a razor isn't usually an option. I read the reviews of the Remington MS2-390 shaver and decided to buy it for him. He LOVES it!! It gives him a really good shave and he said the charge lasts forever! He was out 12 days on his last run and said he didn't have to recharge the whole time. He likes that it can be used corded (in case the battery would run down) or cordless, and that it came with a travel bag. I think it's nice that you can rinse it in water but, again, he usually doesn't have that option. In closing, he said it was the best gift I could have gotten for him. He had previously used a triple-head shaver and he likes the Remington so much better. Linda
  15. This Remington works much better than my older Remington as it cuts much closer, but I still take the same amount of time to shave. It has a good feel in the hand and I would buy another if this one wears out. I tried a Norelco but I could not get the same close shave on my face. The delivery time was much quicker than expected.
  16. I purchsed this product in August of 2011 and have been using it on a daily basis. As of December 11, 2011 the razor will no longer run. The battery has gone flat and will not accept a charge. I have replaced the razor with a different manufacturer. I have used electric razors for the past 25 years and the Remington MS2-390 is the worst razor I have ever had and now it has stopped after less than 4 months use. DO NOT BUY A REMINGTON PRODUCT - YOU WILL BE SORRY
  17. I purchased this around June 2008. I bought it mainly to use as a cordless but liked the corded feature. The first time I tried to use the corded feature, I was shaving using it as a cordless. The battery ran too low to continue so I plugged it in to finish. Oops, does not work that way. It will run, but very, very slow to where it really does no good. The trimmer section I used to trim my facial hair before shaving closely. I thought the trimmer worked for the way I wanted it to. The shaver section I thought shaved close enough for me. I felt some stubble in areas but all in all, I felt comfortable. Yes, it is loud. Why this had to die after 2 1/2 years I don't know. Do not buy this if you are looking for a corded feature on a cordless shaver. That and mine dying is why I gave this 3 stars. I will not buy this one again, so I shall begin my search for a new one.
  18. I thought it was time to replace my old Electric Screen Shaver. I shaved once with this piece of junk. It took three times longer, painfully yanked hairs out, and left many others randomly on my face. Then I used my old shaver which efficiently shaved all the hair this Consumer's Report preferred shaver missed. What was CU thinking? And why do Corporations still make junk like this($$$$$$$$$$$$$)?
  19. While I don't have anything to compare this to, I've decided to start using an electric razor to prevent all those cuts I seem to be getting with a regular razor. Since this model is highly related in a Consumer magazine, I thought I'd give it a try. The shave is relatively fast and easy to do and did give me a good shave. I was surprised however at how noisy it is. I almost feel like I need to wear ear plugs. The other thing I don't like is that it doesn't have a base to sit on. It has to either lie flat on your counter or you need to put it away in a drawer. All together though it does what I bought it for - give me a good shave without getting nicked.
  20. This Remmington MS2_390 didn't produce as close a shave as my old 3 head Rem and was excessivly noisey. Going back to my Panasonic 8103, which I'm not all that crazy about. It is easier on the ears and shaves better, but still not as good as that old 3 head Rem MS3 2000.
  21. First off, there is no substitute for shaving cream and a blade if you want a really close shave. Accepting this fact is the first step in successfully choosing an electric shaver. I use my Remington for daily touch ups so I don't need to do a full shave every day. This is a great product that easily outperforms my old Norelco rotary. I was looking for a no-frills foil-type shaver that lets you power it through an outlet without having to rely on a battery charge, and clean it using running water. This one gets high marks in all categories. Plenty of power, and the foils keep it close, even under nose & chin. Other reviewers have issues with noise but to me that just shows the horsepower under the hood. It's an electrical appliance after all. Thumbs up. Included case, head cover, and cleaning brush are icing on the cake.
  22. Give a good shave and has good battery life. I downgrade the star rating because of cheap build quality: the plastic parts have unfinished edges, the buttons feel cheap ( do not work in a smooth and positive locking fashion), the trimmer when raised to the middle position is not even/level with the foil but instead can have a very slight off angle. The flashing charge light never indicates when the razor is fully charged. Over all it looks like Remington selected a good powerful motor/battery and contracted the cheapest manufacturer they could find to build this shaver. Build quality is well below my previous Braun electric shaver. If you ignore the poor fit and finish, build quality, and lack of a full charge indicator, then this is a good shaver, which is why I kept it.
  23. Pros: Just as good as a braun at shaving multiple positions for sideburn trimmer washable Durable Con: Battery indicator light meaningless. It comes on after 1st use, but the razor still works for the proper run time, the light just doesn't tell you anything because it's on all the time. Summary: I've been using for 18 mos now, no significant problems. I see no reason to buy more expensive razors. I may buy 2nd to keep one in the car!
  24. Received in timely manner. Shaves good and close. Long battery life, first charge lasted for weeks, until red recharge light came on. On second re-charge. very happy. good bang for the buck electric shaver in my opinion. Especially after my old MS2-290's battery had wore out after years of use. Battery had finally worn out, had to be recharged daily by this time and just no longer had enough juice like a new one to give a good shave anymore.
  25. I purchased this shaver to replace a Braun cordless/cord shaver my husband had for about 10 years. I thought I would get him another Braun, but after reading the features and reviews of most of the cordless shavers Amazon offered, this Remington seemed the best choice. I particularly liked that as with the Braun shaver it would replace, it was a cordless/cord model--eliminating any plug-in recharging stand, and also allowing the shaver to be used if ever the recharging feature quit functioning. Also, this shaver happened to be relatively reasonably priced, which was another plus. So far, my husband seems quite pleased with his new shaver. He says that it shaves closely and fits well in his hand. The only reason I gave it a 4 star rather than 5 star rating is that is rather loud. But, if you can live with that, it is likely you will be happy with this shaver.
  26. I went with the Remington after using another brand for decades. As commented in other reviews which, by the way, helped me with my selection, the Remington gives me a very close shave but the motor is loud. However, I can accept the noise level for the quality of the shave. A good bargain for the price.
  27. I had an older Remington that would've still been used had it not broken a plastic part to keep the foils and cutters in place. The battery had died over a year ago but I still used it with the electric cord. This one did so well for the price that I decided to replace the shaver having the same features, two cutters, foil, trimmer and a carrying case. The charge holds over a week and recharges in an hour. The plastic head that holds the foil in place has better method of keeping it secure so I don't envision it breaking like the previous one. Shipment was faster than estimated.
  28. I own the Remington MS2 290 and like others have experienced, the cover over the switch is coming off. I too, have put a thick rubber band over the razor in the switch area and it holds up well. It is a rubber band used from some electronic wiring I had, but the ones on produce would work well too.<br /><br />Anyhow, I ordered this razor in one of the hourly style sales and when i got it, I charged it and turned it on. No problem until I shaved with it about 3 or 4 days later for the first time. I went to turn the 390 on and it did not stay on. I tried several more times and it would finally stay on. The switch does not work properly and after about 4 or 5 tries every time I use it, it finally stays on. The sound on this razor is also very loud. Alot louder than the 290 in side by side comparisons. I feel like I need ear plugs - LOL. OK, not quite that loud, but it is much louder than I am used to.<br /><br />As far as the shave itself, it does do a great job and therefore I give it 3 stars instead of 1 or 2. It seems to shave closer than the old razor even though the blades are both the same. I replaced my blades and foil on the 290 just a short time ago and the shave of the 390 indeed feels much better.<br /><br />01/13/12: Update - I got a replacement from Amazon and willing to give this razor an extra star. I did get worried though at first. I charged it overnight and the first time I used it, it turned on fine and worked great until I went to turn it off....it would not turn off for first 2 clicks of on/off switch. I tried it again with same results. Since then, it has been working fine but still a bit louder than I am used to.
  29. I have used the MS2-290 for a long time and needed to replace it when it wore out. I decided to \\"upgrade\\" to the 390 when I found it on sale for about the same price as a 290. I'm not sure what the differences are, but I like the 390. The first one they sent had some kind of grease on the pop-up trimmer. I had to pull the trimmer up and wipe the grease each use. I decided to return it. They shipped a replacement within a day or two and provided the paperwork to cover return shipping on the first one. For that I am grateful. I would recommend this shaver and this vendor.
  30. This is my second Remington foil shaver. My first was one of the older MS models. That one was retired when the battery went dead which was inevitable.<br /><br />I bought my second one (this model - MS2-390) in July of 2009. It was excellent and gave me great shaves until a month or two ago when the trimmer broke. Basically it refuses to stay retracted and thus is constantly running so I can't actually use the foil head unless I hold the trimmer in the retracted position with my thumb. This basically makes the shaver useless.<br /><br />I've tried taking a look and it seems the simple mechanism that holds the trimmer in it's 3 \\"modes\\" (fully retracted, slightly extended, and fully extended) is pretty shoddy. You can clearly see it's just a cheap piece of plastic that rocks back and forth to release the trimmer. When I pay $60 for something I fully expect such a simple mechanism to last more than 2 years. Needless to say the problem occurred after warranty was up, so here I am deciding whether I should buy another one and hope for the best. I really do love the shaver; just wish it would last.
  31. This is the first Microscreen Shaver that I have owned. Up to now, I have used three head rotary shavers only. If this highly recommended shaver is the best a Microscreen can do, I am not impressed. It gives a fair shave if you work at it (and I do mean work) but the noise is enough to wake the dead. Nearly any three head rotary shaver is better, even the low end jobs. I am switching back.
  32. very good shaver; top rated by consumer reports and very inexpensive; even for a rotary shaver user this product shaves very close. the only issue is the top which has a tendency to come off easily
  33. After following the advice of someone elses post on this particular shaver, I let it charge overnight before using it for the 1st time. I shave almost daily (except most weekends) and have not had to charge it again since. Today is the 21st and I bought it on the 17th of LAST month. So , I give the battery life 5 stars.<br /><br />Keep in mind, I can't grow a full beard, just a goatee & a soul patch, but the stubble that does come in is thick. For the quality of the cut I give it 4 stars. Seems the trimmer doesn't catch everything as good as my previous Remington MS3(3 rows of blades) did and that 3rd razor noticeably makes a difference in the time is takes to get a clean shave and how many times I've got to pass the blades over my face.<br /><br />As far as noise goes... It's an electric razor. There's a motor in it. It goes buzz near your ears. Noise should be expected.<br /><br />I've tried the circular cutting electric razors in the past and didn't care for it. Well, my face didn't. I also found that with the circular ones, you can't press as firm with it on your face as you can with the rows of screens in microscreen razors to get a really, really smooth shave.<br /><br />Bottom line, glad I bought this model.<br />Would I buy it again? Yes, but if/when they come out with another MS3, I'll get that one instead.<br />Worth the price.<br />May stock up on blades now as I found with the last one that the prices of blades go up when local stores no longer carry the electric razor. (supply and demand)

  38. While this shaver does do a nice quick shave, the price is too high. This is far and away the loudest shaver I've ever heard, and shaving near my ears is a horrible experience because it's so painfully loud. Near the end of my use, I'd put one finger in my ear to block the noise. I realized just how silly that was and went back to my old stand-by panasonic (10 years old!). I wouldn't be surprised if this were loud enough to cause hearing loss. In addition, cleaning the shaver is a bit difficult because of the shoddy construction. The razors fall off their supports with the slightest jiggling, so I had to hold them in one hand, getting hair dust all over. Overall, this is one of the sorriest pieces of equipment I've bought.

  43.   44. Remington MS2-390 Microscreen Rechargeable/Corded Men's Shaver - When you haven't purchased a new electric razor in many years, you forget how comfortable a new shaver can be. I have been a Remington user for years, so it was not a difficult decision to stick with them - and I am glad I did. Holds a long charge, affordable and most of all - very comfortable. Highly recommended.
  45. I,ve owned electric razors for years and the Remington line really sucks. The initial cut and closeness is fine but the blade block metal is either four times as hard as the foil(screen)or the tolerance is too tight. This in turns eats or tears a hole in the screen every 3-4 weeks. At over $37.00 a replacement set this sucks big time. I've e-mailed their customer service and was told that excessive pressure causes premature wear and set me a 10% off coupon, sounds like marketing and engineering got a bonus for this design. Funny that my brothers does the same thing! Buy this poor design at the risk of slicing your face with no warning or emptying your wallet every four weeks. I'll stick with the Brauns fixed blades from now on. Their block last two years and the foil close to one.
  46. FIRST SEVERAL WEEKS FELT LIKE THE THING WAS PULLING THE BEARD OUT INSTEAD OF CUTTING IT OFF. INSTRUCTIONS CAUTION IT TAKES SEVERAL WEEKS TO GET TO OPTIMAL PERFORMANCE, BUT REALLY....
  47. Pretty good shaver for the $$. You have to run it MANY times over your face to get a reasonable shave and it is not a terribly \\"close\\" shave but it is good for a quick shave when there is not much time. When a really close shave is needed, probably best to go with a blade...
  48. I read the reviews, ignored the few bad ones and bought this shaver. My previous Remington's (from many years ago) were always solid units and performed well enough. Got this shaver 3 weeks ago, charged it per the manual, used it for 2 weeks and it gave a good shave. Then I had a problem with the trimmer not retracting (already mentioned by a few in the reviews). And the final blow is that I've recharged this shaver a few times now (manual says that it may take a few recharges to bring battery up to full capacity) and today with a full charge indicated from last nights charging, the shaver only ran about a minute. Plugging it in to the cord would not keep the shaver running. It's going back, nothing worse than starting your day with a miserable product.
  49. My previous 3-foil Remington MS3-2700 performed admirably for quite a few years, but the battery was beginning to wear out and replacement foils are no longer readily available from Remington. The closest replacement I could find was this MS2-390. They're almost identical in appearance other than the earlier model has 3 blades and this one has 2. My thoughts after a month with it: PRO - cuts as well as the old Remington on my hair (still not as close as a blade, but I prefer the convenience) - battery life is as advertised -- about 2 weeks of 4-5 minutes shaves - no noisier than my old Remington, and not a problem for me (I think the reviews complaining of noise are from folks moving from rotaries or blades) CON - on the old MS3-2700, the trimmer popped up instantly. On this shaver, it rises up ever-so-slowly (about 2 seconds from button push to full height). It's annoying having to wait that long for the trimmer. - the blades are held to the body/motor by clipping them to two plastic posts. The posts have a half-circle hole at the top--about 200 degrees circumference--and the blades clip into this hole via a small plastic mount. When cleaning the shaver with the supplied brush it is very easy to pop the blades off the posts. Since this is a simple plastic friction-fit, I'm concerned this attachment will be the first thing to wear out. I now brush very carefully with downward pressure on the blades to try to keep them from popping off too often. Overall it's a nice shaver, but there seems to be a little more engineering for cost control rather than durability on this unit when compared to my previous Remington. It's subtle, but I'm still going to knock off a star for it.
  50. Very pleased with the razor. Much smoother shaving than my previous. Appreciate having a light indicating that the razor needs charging. No surprises!
  51. I am very pleased with this shaver. It provides a very close and comfortable shave with minimum effort. Much better than previous Microscreen from Remington. Was able to get five days without recharging with no problem. It is well balanced and easy and comfortable to hold. Two small areas could be improved: (1) improvement could be in the off/on button which requires two hands to operate; and (2) during cleaning, the cutter blade will sometimes come off - but is easy to reassemble. Yes - I would definitely buy it again.
  52. I've purchased many Remington products over the years, so I'm familiar with the brand and quality. This shaver is no exception. If you want bells and whistles...keep looking. I wanted a basic, nothing fancy, twin bladed shaver with trimmer and that's what I got. It does the job without a lot of fuss and a good price. This would make a great 'first shaver' for a young fella.
  53. Last of the really good razors!! This is the Remington quality I've enjoyed for over twenty five years......<br />Is there any wonder these razors can be found on some websites selling for $200+ ?<br />The newer models are all junk.
  54. This Remington microscreen gives a good shave, I find it to be noisy and a little awkward to handle. It holds a charge for about 60 minutes and gives adequate red light warning before it stops. The one hour recharge is standard for the industry. Because I was used to a rotary shaver, it took me awhile to get used to the broad head of the Remington, but it now works fine. The on/off button could be more responsive. I find that I usually have to press it a couple of times to get it to respond. Overall, It's a good shaver and I would probably buy it again.
  55. After trying a Panasonic shaver, and not liking the closeness of the shave, I returned it to Amazon (They are great for making returns easy) and immediately ordered this Remington. I'd been a Remington user before, and this one didn't let me down. It shaves close as a blade for most parts of my face. And I like the fact that it can be cleaned with water. Remington's microscreen seems to work best on my face.
  56. UPDATE - 08/12/2012 - I had to buy another one because I dropped it, by accident, and broke the shaving head, in march of 2010!!! I didn't know they still sold them until last week and I bought another one. It is loud but does a great job and now that I am retired I have every 2nd or third day. I have bought 3 Norelco's and they stink. I am using a Braun and its OK. It's the 3rd one of 5 type you can buy. I will stay with this one !!!<br /><br />I bought a Wahl first. NOT a good buy. This shaver works great. It's is a little loud but it shaves MUCH better than the Wahl and the Norelco I had. I have NO problem with the noise. I shave every other day because of a sensitive skin and this works great!! Also I'm on heavy blood thinners and can get cut at all. This shaver works best for me.
  57. I've owned this shaver for about 2 months and experience the beginnings of a problem right from first use. A small cleaning brush comes with the shaver and the manual instructs on how to use it for cleaning the cutters (not to be used on the cutting screen). First time I tried using the brush, one of the cutters popped off. Later I found that this can be prevented, sort of, if you pinch the ends of the cutters between your fingers to hold them in place. Or, alternatively, pop the cutters off--which, in retrospect is what I should have done all along. As it is, I dusted out the cutters this morning and the gray plastic holder for one of the cutters popped off, exposing the cutter spring, which did NOT come off and go down the drain, luckily. That gray plastic fitting for the cutter fits in a tight rubber sleeve. I can re-attach the cutter & fitting, but not so it inserts into the rubber sleeve or boot that protects it. Is this some kind of design flaw? I don't know. But I will have to write the company... while I shave with a blade razor. BTW the shaver performs very well. Otherwise.
  58. This razor was recommended by Consummer report, and I deceided to try it. The razor does a good job and keeps a charge for a long time. After reading some of the reviewss, I deceided not to rinse it with water, just lightly bump it against the sink to get must of the whisker out. So far I like it and it shaves close.
  59. The front screen wore out(small holes) after only one week, and was VERY difficult in removing to replace. I guess you get what you pay for. Holliston,Massachusetts.
  60. After two months of using this razor based on reviews here, I am throwing it away. Terrible shave...does poor job of removing hairs under chin. Do not recommend this product to anyone.
  61. The Remington MS2-390 is a good close shave (magnesium blades). The only quibble would be that the trimmer is too long to be good on a mustache... but it does work well (half way up) for cutting the longer hairs while you shave (after the weekend).
  62. Very good product. It was a gift for my husband and he likes it.
  63. One thing to keep in mind is that almost any new razor, nowadays, is going to seem remarkably superior to the one you put away after years of use and months of deciding whether or not to install those new screens/heads/cutters, what-have-you.<br /><br />And that's the way it is with this one: it does great work compared to the older Norelco I had. However, I recall that years ago that Norelco was a revelation compared to the Remington I finally gave up on.<br /><br />Some notes: it is louder/\\"buzzier\\" than the Norelco, but the keys for me are price combined with a very good Consumer Reports rating and the fact that you can't overcharge and damage the battery--you don't have to be there to unplug it when it's charged.<br /><br />A good, close shave for the money. We'll see how I feel after a year.<br /><br />NB: After two years I still feel very positive about the razor. I replaced the screens and blades at 14 months and this was a good move. The batteries continue to hold their charge superbly.<br /><br />After four years (October 2010): batteries are still perfect and I am replacing the screens and blades this month. Why change?<br /><br />After another year (now October 2011) I once again replaced the baldes and it was \\"like new.\\" Still no problem whatsoever with battery life.
  64. I've now shaved 3 times with this. The first two times were pretty horrible and brought back some bad skin issues. But that all healed in a day or two and now that my face has begun to adjust I'm amazed. The shave is almost if not equal to a straight razor. I'm optimistic that the shave will get even better. It is very loud but makes short work of shaving. However it does miss occasional hairs but they're unnoticeable and can quickly be remedied with the trimmer.
  65. Been using the Remington for a month. Had a Norelco rotary for years and decided to try a foil model. This shaver received a very good review in a non-profit \\"consumer\\" magazine that has \\"reports\\" (are we allowed the use the magazine's name?). The Remington shaves closer than the Norelco. I think it's as close as a blade. The Remington is louder than I'm used to; and the pop-up trimmer isn't as handy as the Norelco (perhaps I just need to get used to the trimmer). Bottom line: shaves really well at a great price.
  66. Shaver operates well. Insructions indicate red light indicates need to recharge within a short time but red light is always on in use even immediately after full charge.
  67. Excellent shaver. Holds a charge for at least a dozen shaves. Trimmer works well. Easy to clean.
  68. About the only thing I like about this razor is the battery charge seems to hold up quite well. I don't have a heavy beard, and would expect a fairly close shave, but I am left with what feels like a five o'clock shadow. Probably sould have spent the extra bucks and bought a Braun.
  69. I am very happy with the performance of this Electric Razor. It gives a nice close shave. The purchase price was better than I was quoted from any other source.
  70. It's just average in terms of the closeness of the shave, a little harder to clean than some because the shaving heads tend to fall out when brushing out the shavings, and it's extremely noisy during use. Still, for the price, it's a good deal.
  71. By following the directions, it works great. Shave is comfortable and close. Two-position trimmer cuts the longer hair on neck and sideburns. FYI, there was a problem with the trimmer and Amazon replaced the shaver quickly without any hassle or charge. Amazon rocks!
  72. At first I liked this razor, but within two weeks of use the microscreen somehow got a tear in it and the razor cut my face while using it. I don't know how the tear occured, but it did. I returned it for my money back and plan to buy another Norelco rotary.
  73. I bought both this Remington and the Braun top of the line to compare them when my Braun 6000 series failed after 10 years (and it had replaced a Braun 5000 series). I fully intended to try both. Consumer Reports liked the Braun best but the Remington was their Best Buy at 1/3 of the price. The result? I never even used the new Braun. The Remington arrived first, is ergonomically better in your hand, and while it is loud it is not louder than my old Braun ever was. The shave is as close as any electric can be, and that admittedly is nowhere near as close as a blade and never will be... but that is beside the point. The razor does for $50.00 what the Braun does for three times that, this has a much smaller footprint to store and does not need the stupid cleaning solution the Braun requires (and the not cheap solution needs frequent changing too). Hey get this too... you CANNOT send the Braun back to Amazon as they will not accept it because the cleaning solution they send with the razor is deemed too hazardous to get back in the mail. So the 30 day no questions asked guarantee on the Braun is actually a 30 days \\"hey send it back to Braun it is not our problem anymore\\" guarantee. Nice huh? Buy the Remington.
  74. This shaver does what it advertises. It gives a good, close shave. I have no regrets buying this product.
  75. I have a beard. I have never been able to use an electric shaver effectively. But with a blade - lathering, shaving and cleanup were always a chore. Sometimes I would wait longer between shaves than I should, because of the production required. Because of this shaver's high rating by Consumer Reports, I decided to give it one more try . I haven't used a blade since. It's quick, effective and best of all, I can navigate around my beard and finish the job with the handy attached clipper. It's great!
  76. I bought this shaver for my boyfriend who never had an electric shaver before. The idea of getting the electric shaver was to shorten the shaving time but this one made it dramatically longer. The first shave took over 30 minutes. I thought maybe he was doing it wrong but his father even coached him and he did everything the package said but it didn't get much better. The package does say that it will get faster in time but it hasn't gotten to the 3-5 minute shave my dad and sister's boyfriend has. It now takes him 10-15 minutes to shave with this razor and he still has to use non electrical razors to get everything. He gets a sort of razor rash with it too. He does have thick hair and sensitive skin so that may have to do with it. So yeah, if you are like him, don't but this shaver... It may work for those with thick skin and thin hair, that's the only reason why I didn't give it one star.
  77. Had this razor for a month now as a replacement for a 7 year old Norelco (Philips) which had the head come apart. The cost of parts to get that back up and running was about the same as the Remington. Impressions after a month...works well. Gives a clean and close shave. Noisy compared to the Norelco, but that is probably to be expected when going from a rotary head to a reciprocating design. Easy to clean. Very good battery life. Beard trimmer mechanism looks kind of weak, but works well enough. Excellent value for the price. Would give 4.5 stars if possible, with 1/2 mark off for the noise and beard trimmer.
  78. This is a basic shaver. If price is your criteria, then its probably a decent buy. It's noisy, and it has only two cutting heads. But it will give you a decent shave, eventually. It doesn't appear to be made to last a long time. Personally, I would recommend spending a few dollars more and get a Norelco rotary shaver.
  79. I purchased the razor because of consumer reports and the reviews of the shaver on amazon. The razor is great! I shaved with my current Panasonic razor and then with the Remington. The Remington shaved what the Panasonic missed for an even closer shave. I liked the Panasonic, the Remington a much better shaver. The Remington is a little louder but I am very happy with the purchase. What makes this even better is that amazon had the best price I found. I now check amazon for price and reviews before purchasing anything, even auto parts. The last part I purchased through amazon for my truck was half the price the auto stores wanted for the exact same part from the exact manufacturer.
  80. Bought the MS2-390 after seeing it highly rated in consumer reports. First Remington I've owned in 15 years (I've had all Norelcos since) and they've definitely improved. Gives a VERY close shave. I only shave every 3-4 days, and no shaver I've ever had will get all the longish hairs the first time. The MS2-390's no different, and you do have to make a second/final pass to get the remaining stragglers. If you shave every day, that shouldn't be as much of a problem. Surprisingly Great Feature: The middle position on the trimmer that lines it up even with the main cutters. Lets you mow down several days of growth just before the main cutters finish the hairs off. It's not perfect of course, but for under $50, I have no regrets at all with this shaver.
  81. This is the first item I have bought online and I was thrilled with the fast delivery, it came exactly when they said it would. The shaver is great, easy to use and a very close shave, excellent.
  82. This foil shaver was rated a \\"Best Buy\\" in Consumer Reports, but I found it less effective than the old rotary electric I'd been using. It misses numerous whiskers, even after repeated strokes. The charging-alert light comes on sooner than expected, and it was only after receiving the shaver that I learned its battery is not replaceable, which means that when it dies the shaver is finished. Remington says it should last 4 to 5 years, but that sounds iffy. Also, if you have to plug it in for a recharge so often, you might as well use a corded razor to begin with.

  90. I had been a devotee of regular razors, and had a Panasonic Vortex for evening touch ups, which broke and had to be thrown out after just a year in use. I got this one, not expecting much because of the price, despite the top ranking on Consumer Reports' website. I am happy to report that this shaver not only outperforms the Panasonic, but has now become my daily shaving instrument. It shaves almost as closely as a regular razor, it is comfortable, and it is quick. If it lasts even one year, I'll be happpy to replace it with the same model.
  91. I bought this because of a Consumer Report review but I have to say that the shave is no where close to a razor
  92. I gave this to my boyfriend as a Christmas present and he loves it! He has heavy beard and it gives him a close shave every time he uses it.
  93. I've had the same Braun 5610 for over four years, and even after maintenance and regular head and screen replacement, it's getting a little long in the tooth. Saw this Remington MicroScreen MS2-390 received the Consumer Reports Best Buy rating and just had to have it. I didn't think it would be necessary to spend the $180 for the top of the line Consumer Reports rated shaver. The back of the product packaging reinforces the advertising - shaves as close as a blade or your money back. I've had this shaver for just under 30 days (the guarantee is no longer offered after 30 days) and I'm definitely getting my money back. I've tried this shaver in many scenarios - regular daily shaving, every other day, the occasional long 3rd day, wet, dry, etc. Cleaning according to instructions (disassemble and brush) after every use. Even purchased the Remington Shaver Saver can of compressed air with lubricant and have used it religiously. I can only find one scenario where this shaver is somewhat passable - if you shave without fail every single day. No less than at least once every 24 hours. I'm not that guy - my habit is to shave every other day. Unfortunately, the shaver is useless on hairs longer than 1/16 of an inch. With 2 (and sometimes 3) day growth, this shaver routinely misses hairs 1/8 to 1/4 inch long, even after going over them again and again and again. Have experienced this in all facial locations - sideburn area, chin, neck, cheeks - it just doesn't have what it takes to reliably do what it is supposed to do, which is to cut facial hair. If you're looking for a smooth piece of metal that massages your face, this is great. If you want a shave, you could do better by rubbing a brick on your face than this shaver does. In frustration, I picked up the four+ year old Braun after 15 minutes of shaving trying to get this Remington to shave my face, and the Braun was done within 30 seconds. That's proof enough for me - I'm getting my money back and either going to get another set of blades and screen for my old Braun, or pick up the latest Braun model. I will never again buy a Remington shaver - pure and simple its a waste of time and money.
  94. I just started using this shaver a couple weeks back, after finally getting tired of the frequent nicks from my razor. While this shaver can't quite match the closeness of a regular wet shave, it comes pretty darn close (and without the bleeding!). I consider myself to have pretty sensitive skin, and this shaver gives me no problems. I use a Derma Bloc Pre-Shave talc (similar to Remington's FaceSaver). I actually enjoy shaving now! The only complaint I have with this shaver is its trimmer. The trimmer's toggle button is cheap feeling, and after two weeks of use, the trimmer raises *very* slowly when the button is pressed. It's gotten to the point that I just pull the trimmer up with my fingers instead of waiting for it to raise on its own. With that said, the trimmer does a fine job trimming sideburns, the back of the neck, and the random whisker. Overall, for an electric shaver that provides a close shave, can be used cordless or corded, can be rinsed off after use, and is highly regarded by Consumer Reports, I think it is a great value at $45.00!
  95. I ordered this razor on Amazon and when I received it I quickly learned the pop up trimmer was broken. Now you're probably wondering why I would give it 5 stars if it was busted upon arrival. Here's why. I was so impressed with how close the shave was and given the little use I'd get from the trimmer I considered keeping it but decided to return it. I'm the type that likes to see what I'm buying so instead of dealing with shipping cost issues I decided to head to Target to find this razor. They do not sell this model so I opted to try the Braun 3 series 340 model. This has the Triple Blade (two foils and the cutter in between the foil meant for longer hairs.) Although the build quality seemed better the shave was not even close to as smooth and this went back in a day. I then stopped in a Fry's store and found the Remington MS2-390 as well as the Panasonic ES8043 model and decided to try the Panasonic. It boasts the sharpest blades and most aggressive cutting angle at 30 degrees along with a super fast 13,000 RPM motor. The Panasonic had the same Triple Blade Shaving system as the Braun 340 and the same type of shave. Both the Braun and Panasonic caused minor irritation and left significant amounts of stray hairs on my neck that required the use of the trimmer to clean up. After 2 weeks with the Panasonic and the use of my old Norelco rotary (shaver I'm trying to replace) to finish up the neck area, I returned it. I went back to Fry's and bought the Remington MS2-390 again. The pop-up trimmer works this time but don't expect it to fling into action. When hitting the buttons it slowly eases its way into position. With all this said the important thing is the shave. The Remington shaves soooo much faster and soooo much closer than the Braun and Panasonic. There is no reason for debate on which shaves closer. I realize that different beards require different types of shavers but the difference is so astounding that I can't imagine someone getting a better shave with the alternatives than with the Remington. One more thing to note is the cutters and overall head of the shaver is considerably wider on the Remington than the Braun and Panasonic so it requires a lot less time to shave. This is probably a lot more than you cared to read but take it from someone who has tried the shavers in this price range. GET THE REMINGTON!!!
  96. I bought this razor for my husband and it may not be top of the line but it does exactly what he wanted in an electric razor. He's happy with it and would recommend it to anyone and the price was right!
  97. My guy loves this razor. Keeps a charge for a long time. Would buy again.
  98. I gave this shaver to my dad, my son and son-in-law for Christmas. None of them are happy with it. They all have spots that they just can't get at with this shaver. Huge disappointment. They say the shaver also catches their skin and it hurts. I do not recommend this product.

  103. I have a very heavy beard and must shave every day. If I skip a day for any reason, I pay for it the next day when I have to shave because any razor has a hard time on my beard with more than 24 hours of growth. I've used Remington microscreen razors for more than 25 years though all the different models they've made. This MS2-390 is the best one they've ever made. It's not the latest or fanciest model but it works the best. The 2 head like the MS2-390 gives a much better shave and it's much faster. I have several of the newer Remington models (with 3 heads) in a drawer. They were a waste of money and died after less than a year of operation. Don't waste your money on the newer models or the fancy names. Get the MS20390 Remington, it's a winner.
  104. This is a comfortable shaver which will remain charged through many shaving cycles. It provides a close shave to the flat areas, but when it comes to the compound curves at the base of the jaw near the ears and neck, it requires a bunch of work and time to get a good shave.<br /><br />The head must be held exactly flat, OR the edge of the screen or the trimmer will catch the whiskers, and THAT is not real comfortable. After a couple of pulls, you learn the technique pretty quickly. The hair trimmer just doesn't retract FAR ENOUGH to be completely clear of the shaving heads.<br /><br />I am a long-time Remington person; the last one is no longer built or I would have bought it instead. This one was a top recommendation of CR. It has actually driven me back to shaving with a blade, believe it or not.<br /><br />I would not buy this again nor recommend it to anyone.

  115. I looked at a lot of different shavers and read a lot of customers review before buying this shaver. I checked with Consumer Reports and it was rated as a 'best buy\\". I have had this shaver for almost 3 weeks and it shaves very good. I shaved for 13 days on one charge. It shaves close and fairly fast. My only complaint is that twice while shaving it gave me a slight \\"pinch\\", don't know why it did. Over all I would buy this shaver again. It comes with a vinyl pouch that is a bit small to hold the shaver and charger. If you have never used an electric shaver before be advised that electric shavers eventhogh they shave close, your beard will start coming out sooner that if you use a blade, but at least you will not have the nicks and cuts that a blade razor can give you. Make sure that you charge it for 24 hours when you get it before using it, eventhough it has a charge when you get it, give it 24 hours. I would buy this shaver again.

And, definitely, the closest shave of any electric I have ever had.
  131. The shave is great, however, it is a bit loud. But, I can live with it.
  132. Summary: This is a lousy shaver I bought this to replace a Norelco shaver that was about 10 years old. My wife complained that the Norelco took too long for me to shave. I think I had replaced the Norelco heads maybe twice. The Remington is LOUD! It really bothered my wife (it will wake someone else up). But the real problem is that is can not deal with even one days of beard growth. I don't have a heavy beard but this shaver will not cut my neck hairs unless I shave twice a day (I had to use the trimmer 1st). Then after 6 monthes the screen tore and began cutting my face. I decided to break out my old 10 year old Norelco while I decided what to do with the Remington. Wow! The old Norelco still worked perfectly, was quiet and could deal with even a 2 days beard with no problem. The Remington goes in the trash!
  133. Great shaver for the price. Does an excellent job, but it is loud. I've owned several Norelco's, Braun's and Remington's over the years, but keep coming back to Remington. They do a good job at a fair price.
  134. I've used this razor for about three weeks and one of the cutter blades has fallen off twice while cleaning it. Razor has required charging more frequently than advertised. It does give a good shave and the trimmer is excellent.
  135. First let me say that I have a very heavy beard and fast growth. Twirling head shaver - like Norelco will not cut my beard, have tried as friends recommended. I have had a Remington in the past and was well satisfied, but went back to blades many years ago. I decided to try a Remington again after a great review in Consumer Reports. It is super fast and cuts as close as any electric shaver I have ever used. I get great battery life also; - can easily get 14-15 shaves per charge (although not important to me). It is a great shaver for the money. If and when this one dies, I will buy another just like it.
  136. Very difficult to get a good close shave. Shaver head is not comfortable as it shaves -- seems to be like trying to put a square peg into a round hole -- it doesn't want to follow the contours of the face. Also, the power switch is very difficult to push. You have to push your finger fairly hard and deep into the recessed hole to activate/deactivate the switch. Motor does seem to be pretty powerful. Have not had it long enough to really evaluate the staying power of the battery charge.
  137. Had a Remington shaver years back and was very satisfied. This newer one was a big disappointment. I would not bother. Other comments about being noisy are correct. HOWEVER, the big complaint was that it did not do a very good job at all especially as compared to my old Norelco.
  138. I don't have any complaints after 1 week of use except how loud it is. I also wish the trimmer worked a little better but I don't know of many electric shavers with trimmers. I'm happy with my purchase.
  139. I used a MS2-300 for years until it finally broke. I bought the MS2-390 in hopes it would provide a similar shave and because it tends to have the least expensive replacement blades. So far I'm pleased. It shaves almost as well as the MS2-300. Yes some spots require multiple passes and some skin stretching, but I find this is common for electric shavers. While it is loud, it is noticeably quieter than the older model and appears to be more water resistant. The build quality seems a bit better as well.<br /><br />Unfortunately, there were a few regressions from the older model. The \\"pop-up\\" trimmer moves up very slowly (the 300 popped up instantly) and unlike the 300, the 390 has a large power adapter that can make it difficult to plug in anything else when it is charging.
  140. The Winner Is... The Panasonic ES8109S 3-blade - barely. Put the Remington blades and cutter (keeping the center blade of the Panasonic) on a Panasonic 13,000 RPM shaver and you would have the World's best electric shaver. The Remington shaved a little closer than the Panasonic and provided a faster shave. However, the difficulty in cleaning, noise and lack of a charging base tipped me to the Panasonic as the final choice. This is a review of three Panasonic models; ES8243A (4-blade), ES8109S (3-blade) and ES7109, the Remington MS2-390, the Norelco 8260 CC and the Braun Series 5 8995 (8985 & 8975 only differ in displays and cleaning). I have an average beard and have been using electric shavers (foils and rotaries) over 30 years. The models here are no better than any of the other higher quality shavers I've owned. It takes about 10 minutes (no shaver will give you a first-pass close shave) to get to that good dry shave (with or without pre-electric gels/oils) and you do have to put pressure on to get a close shave. This means recharging every 4-5 days. Gels/oils do make the process easier - not faster - and I have reviewed six of them on their Amazon sites. ES8109S: This 3-blade shaver gives a very close shave, with some work. It does give off a higher pitch `whine', while shaving, that is somewhat annoying, but is not what I would consider noisy. Nor is the cleaning operation noisy. Based upon other reviewers, I was expecting it to sound like a lawn mower, but it is just an occasional buzzing noise as it cleans. The \\"Arc Foil\\" design slows shaving (see discussion, below). ES8243A: I had hoped that the four blades of the Panasonic ES8243A just might be able to give a superior shave. As it turns out, the large four-blade surface is like trying to keep the end of a 2x4 on your face. It makes cutting in the areas where you don't have a lot of skin area (chin, jaw line, upper lip, base of sideburns, etc) more difficult. In fact, I think that the fourth blade in the middle actually interferes with a better shave and these two middle blades are not as good as the primary cutters. The \\"Arc Foil\\" design makes it even slower (see discussion, below). Another future problem with the 4-blade system is that you'll want to buy a new shaver when your blades and foil need to be replaced. What kind of an idiot is going to spend 80% of the cost of a new shaver just to get a set of new cutter blades and foil? All in all: the ES8243A 4-blade is a poor value. ES7109S: The flat design of the foil is a better design than the \\"Arc Foil\\" (see below). Unfortunately, this shaver has an under-powered motor and the floating head that cannot be locked. Panasonic discussion: Panasonic had developed an outstanding shaver line some ten years ago. My old ES8067 still shaves closer than this new \\"NANO Technology\\"- a misnomer (marketing gimmick). I think the reason is that Panasonic's older models came with cutting blades with the individual blades having been about half the width of all of Panasonic's newer cutting blades (including replacements). This means more surface area on the newer blades and that means less cutting. Remington has the ideal blades (that Panasonic used to make) and it shows in closer cutting and less time spent doing so. Additionally, these new Panasonic \\"Arc Foil\\" shavers have the foil curving AWAY from your face at the ends of the foil, further decreasing exposure to the blades and requiring many more passes to cover the same area. Unfortunately, Panasonic puts their better motor (13,000 RPMs) only on these ill-conceived \\"Arc Foil\\" designs. Battery time on the Panasonics is the shortest of all shavers reviewed here. The Panasonic trimmers are so narrow, on all of these models, that you will not be able to trim sideburns with one attempt. You will have to re-position the trimmer to get what you missed. This increases the probability that you will get an uneven sideburn. The Remington MS2-390 has the blades that thePanasonics should have (and did have years ago): flat foil area (not \\"Arc Foiled\\"), good length (25% longer) and ultra thin cutting blades. As a result, closeness of the shave is better and time spent is shorter. This is, however, the loudest (and it is loud) of all shavers and there are no bells and whistles. Using a pre-shave oil/gel will gum up the blades, as with any shaver, but these blades pop off with even the slightest brushing so be prepared to watch them fall into the sink with every cleaning attempt. A charging stand would greatly increase the convenience of this shaver. Remington did a poor job with the details. The Braun Series 5 8995 tries hard (you can hear noticeable slowing when necessary pressure is applied, like a lawn mower when it reaches thicker grass), but it doesn't get quite as close as the Panasonics or Remington without leaving a stronger burning sensation after the shave. The Braun can also leave burn marks and even cuts (nose and lips) that will bleed. Odd: you would think that, with it getting so close as to actually burn the skin, it would also give a closer shave. I suppose this is proof that shavers cannot \\"lift\\" hairs to cut better. Additionally, the design of the handle is inferior, making positioning more difficult. It does have a much wider trimmer and longer battery life between charges, though. The Norelco 8260 CC: I used this rotary-type of shaver for many years during the 80's. I switched to foil and found I could get a closer shave. This is still the case. Additionally, because of the circular blades, it is somewhat difficult to target certain spots for cleanup. However, this is the quietest shaver. PS: don't accept the nonsense about giving your face 30 days to adjust, unless you are coming off a blade. If you are accustomed to an electric shaver, you only need a week or two to determine the difference. The only thing magical about 30 days is that you can no longer return it for a refund - what a coincidence!
  141. I've been using this razor for just over three months now and will be switching. I bought it because it was a Consumer Reports \\"best buy\\" and had good Amazon reviews. I can't disagree with those ratings, but I discovered I liked my old rotary better and just purchased a new rotary to replace this one. Plusses: the shaver is comfortable to use, no razor burn, and it provides a slightly closer shave than a rotary (oscillating razors typically do shave a little closer than a rotary). Minuses: about twice as loud as the rotary with a \\"buzz\\" instead of a \\"whir.\\" Shaves more closely, yes, but shaves MUCH more slowly -- takes about three times as long! If I spend as much time with it as I do with my rotary, the shaving job is extremely spotty. It requires many more passes to achieve the same shave, and then several more to reach its optimum. It does not handle longer whiskers well at all. If I skip shaving for the weekend, the rotary works just fine on Monday with little more effort than a daily shave. However, with this one, if I skip shaving for the weekend, I might as well shave with a blade on Monday since it takes a good 12-15 minutes for this razor to slowly grind away at the two-day stubble, and it misses any whiskers that have started to get even a slight curl. The trimmer bar also misses curly whiskers unless I go at them from about three directions. The razor does not clip the whiskers at the skin level, but instead incrementally chips away at them -- I don't wind up with shaved whiskers, but with a whisker powder that sprikles all over the bathroom counter and can be hard to clean up. I've learned to hold my breath while shaving; one time I had a cold and blew my nose after finished with the shave -- the tissue looked like my mucous was filled with pepper from the whisker powder that the razor threw into my nostrils as I shaved my upper lip. Finally, the trimmer bar is no more efficient that the cutter blades, requiring a number of passes to make the desired cuts. This razor is FOR: fans of screen razors who shave daily, people with sensitive screen who get razor burn from rotaries, people who prefer taking longer to get slightly closer shave, men with fairly light or fine whiskers without much curl. This razor is NOT for: people sensitive to the loud buzz near the ear, someone who needs a narrower trimmer for nasal or ear hairs, men with coarse or curly whiskers, men (and their significant others) who can tolerate a very slightly less close shave but in half the time, men who occasionally skip a day or two of shaving, men who have been satisfied with a rotary in the past. I happily used a rotary for nine years until it wore out; this was a replacement for it. I just ordered a new version of my worn-out rotary and will be giving this up. On those rare occasions when I need a closer shave than the rotary provides, I'll just use a blade.
  142. Wow! I feel like I've been missing out. I've been using a Braun. And, I always thought it was \\"OK\\". But, this razor cut fast (like on the first pass), gets in the 'hard to reach' spots and gets about as close as my Mach 3 razors when cutting upwards against the lie of the beard. I've only used it once and have owned it for 24 hrs. But, at this point, I have no problem at all recommending this razor.
  143. bought this razor and was completely disappointed, doesn't do the job, find another razor this one is a lemon.
  144. my first electric shaver, so hard to compare. but i like the convenience of the electric shaver vs blades. had to replace the micro screen already because it developed a hole, possibly from using to much pressure when shaving, the replacements are expensive comes with the blades about $30.00. yes it is noisy
  145. Holds a charge VERY well. I don't use it that often, but when I do the charge remains strong! Easy to clean. Only had to replace the blades/foil screen 1 time since. Travels well. One 8-hour charge lasts for several days with daily use.
  146. I received my Remington MS2-390 about a month ago. I use it every day. However, and, perhaps this is a unique instance, but they must have cut the toenails of a herd of elephants before shipping it out to me. This razor has 2 large cutters and should be able to easily cut my beard. The end result is it doesn't. I have to force this razor to cut. I probably should send it back, however, I am so sick and tired of receiving items that are less than advertised, that I either toss it or I put up with it. My question is, what has happened to quality control at our companies? The quality of our management, of our companies here in the U.S., has fallen precipitously. We all should demand that they bring back good quality control. And, by the way, these idiots are the ones taking home big pay checks and I want to ask WHY?
  147. This razor works very well. I have had a Braun for quite a number of years, but was unhappy with the last one as it did not last very long at all. This Remington actually shaves closer and faster than the Braun.
  148. I am pleased with the performance so far. I don't have to go over the same area numerous times to get a close shave and the shaver does not leave stray hairs behind that later have to be removed by the trimmer. The shaver also holds its charge for a much longer time than my previous shaver and has a handy indicator light that tells you when the charge is getting low.
  149. My previous electric razor was a Norelco rotary and I liked it but never got what I considered a close shave. This razor gives a much closer shave, the price was reasonable, and I've had no irritation of my skin.
  150. I've had this shaver for 2 years and the cutting power and effectiveness are great. It gives a really close shave. If you hold the cutting heads between your thumb and forefinger, it is easy to clean and should be cleaned every day. The only beef I have is the short battery life. Even after running the battery down and fully recharging it a couple of times a year, it now continues to die slowly. After 4-5 minutes of use, I have to plug it in and use it as a corded model. The shaver cannot be opened to insert a fresh battery. Instead, you have to toss out the whole shaver and buy a replacement shaver. The battery, which I charge daily, should last longer than 2 years. Probably an intentional design flaw on the part of Remington to get you to buy a new shaver. But I'll probably still buy another 390 because it works well and I figure I can buy 3 of them over the next 6 years for the cost of one newer model.
  151. Consumer Reports gave this shaver top scores so I bought this one. My husband loves it. Great price!
  152. BOUGHT FOR HUSBAND AS A GIFT.<br />HE WAS SURPRISED...VERY HAPPY.<br />SHAVES REALLY GOOD... AND RECHARGEAGBLE.<br />GOOD QUALITY.<br />GOOD PRICE.

  156. I've had this for about half a year, and it works great. Doesn't pull and rip the hair out like others do.
  157. The shaver works perfectly fine. No, it doesn't shave you as close as a razor would, but if you have to shave every day without irritation, this certainly does a more than acceptable job. You'll just have a slightly thicker 5:00 shadow at around -- say, 5:00. My only complaint is that the cutters easily pop out of their slots when you're brushing them. I ruined one of them when it popped out and fell down the drain (I fished it out with a butter knife -- not a great idea). The solution is to simply grip each cutter firmly but gently between the thumb and forefinger while brushing the hair out of it, and then everything's fine. Basically, this is a great shaver for the price, and I am quite satisfied.
  158. This shaver is close and fast. Unfortunately it is loud too. My neck gets missed in areas, so I have to be extra careful. First, I dry shave my neck with both the shaver and then the edger. Last, I put shaving creme on and shave my face and neck. I heard Braun 7 series shaves the neck well, but the cost is at least $175, probably $210. This shaver is a lot cheaper.
  159. My husband loves this shaver. When I read other folks reviews on this shaver one of the things they complained about was the sound...it was too noisy. I knew I would have to give this one a try. My husband complained about new shavers sounding like they were not working. This one sounds and shaves like a good old fashion shaver. Give it a try it does the job!
  160. The product arrived on time and in new condition. Compared to my old Norelco shaver, this Remington is not as good. It does not leave as close a shave as I would like, gives more nicks to my skin, is louder, and leaves some hairs uncut. However, clean-up is easier than for my old Norelco, and the trimmer is better. I would recommend a higher quality shaver than this model.

  164. I really expected better from a Remington product. Shame on me, I guess. Bought this as an Amazon lightning deal, and boy does the old \\"you get what you pay for\\" adage hold true. Except in this case, it's even worse than that. The razor flat out doesn't shave. It pretends to, and it may even get a hair or two by mistake, but you have to run it over the same patch of skin some 5 or 6 times, and it still won't leave anything NEAR a clean shave.   165. I bought this shaver back in June of 2009, and it's still working great. At the time I got it for $47, but would instantly buy it again at the current $60 if mine broke. So back in June of '09 I was 18, didn't need to shave everyday, and had been using a Gilette 3 blade model (not sure, it may have been the old Fusion) to shave when I needed to. I didn't like buying new blades and shaving cream, and so I looked at Consumer Reports and found this as a best buy model, 2nd rated in the foil models, but at the same time also the cheapest. My dad's always had a rotary shaver, so I thought I'd get one, but the foil shavers were cheaper. So I bought this, and I've never regretted it. I also like that it's quicker and easier then a blade shave, and I'm a lazy person who also tends to run late so this is a better option. All this year I've been shaving between 2-7 times a week, with an average of probably 5 times a week since June when I started a full time job (I generally get lazy and don't shave when on my days off, but I do sometimes, since missing a day [or especially two] means the next shave takes longer). I still have not needed to replace the blades or the foils, does a quick, clean shave, any missed hairs (not many) are quickly gotten with the trimmer. I do not need to charge it often at all, and the battery life is still great. I wouldn't even bring the charger on a two week trip, assuming I took trips that long, or I needed to shave on such hypothetical trips. All in all, get this, you won't regret it.
  166. Does not shave as close as expected. Battery life is pretty good so far. It will never beat a wet shave with a razor and foam but no electric ever will. If you are in a hurry and cannot do a wet shave this will do just fine.

  182. I have owned other Remington shavers but this one has to be the best I have ever had. I only use electric razors so this review will not help anyone switching from non-electric. The shave is so smooth and I don't get razor burn on the underside of my neck like before. I was skeptical about the two level pop-up trimmer when I saw it. Now I don't know how I could do without it. The first level of the pop-up trimmer raises it up flush with the shaver heads so while you shave, it also gets those few longer hairs that seem to always elude the shaver. I thought this feature would be horrible, but it really works and has cut down on the time I spent searching for missed hairs. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
  183. This is an inexpensive razor that works quite well. It is not perfect; longish hairs sometimes seem unable to get in the foil openings (why I've awarded 4 and not 5 stars). but for the price it gives a fine shave. Fits comfortably in my hand; charges quickly. Its noise level does not bother me. For special occasions and an occasional touch-up I still go Gillette Mach 5, but this is just fine most of the time.<br />ADDENDUM I've now been using it daily for about three years, and I still like it, but it doesn't seem to shave as well as when new. I have replaced the foil and cutters yearly, so it continues to work well. I highly recommend having a spare foil at all time; it can tear unexpectedly. The only other issue is that the battery now needs to be recharged after every use, not after every three or so as was true when it was new. This is a minor inconvenience,as it still does work fine and never runs out of power before I'm done. Still need to use the Mach 5 occasionally.<br />ADDENDUM 2: I've now been using the razor for about four years and it needs to be replaced. It no longer gives a close shave even with several replacement blades and foils. The rubberized cover over the on/off switch has torn and had to be covered with tape. I suppose the replacement blades and foils could be counterfeit, although the packaging did look like OEM Remington. I've gone back to Gillette.

  190. I bought this for my husband as the razorblades were getting too expensive. We loved the 30 day guarantee but it's working very well. I would recommend this friends and family. You don't have to spend a fortune on an eletric shaver that's for sure.
  191. I recently purchased the Remington MS2-390 shaver. It is a real problem to use. The shaving head leaves a black film on my face each time I use it. Something is coming from the metal screen. Even the cutters inside the head have a \\"smokey\\" film on them when I clean them. After I finish shaving, my face looks like the \\"five o'clock shadow\\". Even the wash cloth picks up this black film, and it is difficult to remove the film from my wash cloth. My face is also irritated, as though I have rubbed the skin with sandpaper. Do not invest your money in this shaver. For 4 years before I bought this NEW version, I had used the same model without any problem. However, during that 4 year period, the manufacturer has made some type of change that is causing this problem.

  195. I've been shaving with this razor now for four months. It produces a smooth, close shave, lots of shaves per charge, no complaints there EXCEPT... It sure would have been nice to know before I bought this that when the rechargeable battery wears down and won't take a charge (they all do, after all), you just throw away the entire razor! Yup, instead of slipping in a new battery, Remington figured out that they could sell a lot more razors if they made it impossible to just replace the battery. Would you do this with your car? Hello, folks! It's the 21st Century, and we try to recycle and reuse these days.
  196. Very disappointed in the shaver, but very impressed by Amazon who are giving me a full refund. I'm clean shaven since I only have a have a light growth, but the shaver was always missing the odd hair, so I was routinely using the trimmer while shaving. The instuctions say to never press hard while shaving, but that only gave a mediocre shave. Pressing harder gave a better shave, but also occasional cuts and now, after just two months of use, a foil that needs replacing. The trimmer is awkward to use for trimming sideburns, nose or ear hair. The head easily comes off during shaving if you accidently touch one of the release buttons. I like the ease of charging, the dual voltage and the overall unit, but as a shaver it is very disappointing for something recommended by Consumer Reports. I used a Braun foil shaver for years without any problems, not even needing a new foil, while for the last ten years I have been using a Norelco rotary. Maybe it is just my minimal facial hair, but I'd be very hesitant about recommending this shaver to anyone. A big thank you to Amazon for the full refund. I'll be back for a new Norelco!
  197. I wasen't getting a very close shave from my Braun shaver. I bought the Remington hoping for a better shave. It gave me a very close shave every day, but didn't irritate my skin. I also like that it is battery or plug in cord operated.

  208. UPDATE May 30, 2011: After using this shaver for over a year, I'm still reasonably satisfied. But I realize now that it does have its faults. It provides a good close shave if I have only one day of beard growth. But anytime that I have gone without shaving for a day or more, it is difficult to get a close shave and it takes much, much longer. It also leaves a lot of random hairs behind that it fails to cut. When this occurs I resort to using my old Norelco, which is a bit slow but it gets the job done where the Remington MS2-390 does not. So, if you don't regularly shave every single day, I would not recommend this shaver. In using the Norelco occasionally, I have also realized that the Remington is 2 or 3 times as noisy as the Norelco. I am reducing my rating from 5 stars to 3 stars as a result of these shortcomings. ---- ORIGINAL REVIEW: I have been using Remington electric shavers for most of my life. My last one is still working after 21 years, just not as well as when it was new. I bought a Norelco as a replacement a couple years ago but I was never entirely satisfied with it and continued using the old Remington. I just received my MS2-390 and so far I am delighted. It takes only one hour for a full charge. Indicator lights show when it is charging, fully charged or needing a recharge. And if the battery is discharged, it can still be used with the charging cord attached. Best of all, this shaver provides a smooth, comfortable shave that is practically as close as I can get with a blade.
  209. I owned another Remington for years and I know these are good products. The Remington MS2-390 is a little noisy, but it gives you a clean shave in a few minutes. Although some people complain about its trimmer, I find it okay. The battery recharges in just a little time and holds the charge for about a week. In addition, its cleaning process is very good. I definitely love it.

  214. Have been using electric shavers for many years (at least 50). The Remington MS2-390 is far and away the best ever. Have previously used the Remington MS2-270 and the Remington 3-3000 in recent years, and this MS2-390 is much better than either, delivering a better shave in less time.   215. I've used medium priced Remington and Braun shavers, never tried other brands. The Remington is a better shaver (at least in this category). It is not really a better shave but it is a smoother and faster shave. Maybe because it has twin heads and the braun one larger head. Not a big deal for me but the trimmer on the Braun is positioned more conveniently. The only issue for some people may be the noise. The Remington is noticeably louder than the Braun but I can't see why this would make a difference to anyone. If you're up in the morning and shaving with an electric shaver you're going to be heard anyway.
  216. [[ASIN:B000H6A02A Remington MS2-390 Microscreen Rechargeable/Corded Men's Shaver]] My Norelco gave out Saturday. The costs and delays to repair them are prohibitive. Although, Amazon said delivery would be 9/14. I received it Tuesday the 13th to Florida. I couldn't wait to try it, since I hadn't shaved in nearly a week. I didn't wait to charge it. I just plugged it in and started shaving. Since some of the hairs on the neck were a little long I used the setting to get them first. No problem, no pulling. Then I cleaned up the little mustache under my nose, my wife calls a fuzzy mess. On to shaving the six day whiskers. Much closer and much quicker than my old Norelco (which cost double the Remington.) I give it 5 stars since it was such an improvement over the Norelco. Also, I was happy to read, the user can insert the batteries and and the screens. One doesn't have to take to a repair shop or mail it like Norelco.

When I compared the outer foils of the Panasonic and Remington, it was soon apparent that the Remington outer foil is of poor quality, very flimsy and quite malleable.
